```{r dataset cleaning}
diabetes <- read_csv('./data/diabetic_data.csv') %>%
  clean_names()

missing <- vector(length = 50)
for (i in 1:50) {
  diabetes[which(diabetes[,i] == '?'),i] <- NA  # recode '?' to NA.
  missing[i] <- sum(is.na(diabetes[,i]))/dim(diabetes)[1]
}

# missing value proportion
col.mis <- which(missing != 0)
rbind(colnames(diabetes)[col.mis],missing[col.mis])

# Therefore, we consider to omit those variables with large number of missing values, i.e., 'weight', 'payer code' and 'medical specialty'. We further omit NA values in other variables.
diabetes <- diabetes %>%
  select(., everything(), -weight, -payer_code, -medical_specialty) %>%
  na.omit() %>%
  arrange(., patient_nbr)
head(diabetes, 10)

summary(diabetes)

```
